result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  Credit for 79 days.  Will be served in Wisconsin State Prison.
5-12-15, Restitution Hearing, Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one; concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Eugene Deramus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion to Interfere in DAI/DOC Policy, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for order to clarify mechanics of satisfying restitution orer and prohibition of contravention thereof.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Victim did not make a request for restitution.
Statements made.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION (will be served in Wisconsin State Prison), consecutive to Count #2, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
Credit for 79 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2 (MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION (will be served in Wisconsin State Prison), consecutive to Count #1, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

COURT ORDERS:
* PAY the DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* Restitution to be determined at an upcoming Restitution Hearing.

Case adjourned to 05-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

Appeal rights given. 

FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court IN CUSTODY with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to two misdemeanors:  Count 1:  Theft [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisconsin Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a).  Count 2:  Disorderly Conduct [a Class B MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 947.01(1).

**NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to 03-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Co-defendant, Webb, raised the issue of competency today.
Case adjourned to 01-28-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Jury Trial.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
The co-defendant plans to file a notice of alibi.
Statements made.
Parties request an adjournment of the trial date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 11-03-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Jury Trial.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi filed by Atty. Gregg Novack on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties remain in a trial posture.
Defense's notice of alibi was filed late, therefore, the Jury Trial date may need to be rescheduled.
State will attempt to complete an  investigation of defense's alibi prior to the 08-06-2014 Jury Trial date.
Statements made.
Court will keep this matter calendared for Jury Trial on 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi filed by Atty. Gregg Novack on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Defense will be filing a notice of alibi soon.
State moves for joinder of this case with case# 14CF96.
Court GRANTS motion and joins this case with case# 14CF96.
State is to file a written motion for joinder by the next court date.
Defense is to file a notice of alibi by the next court date.
Case adjourned to 07-22-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2 for Final Pretrial Conference AND 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
**Court CANCELLED THE 05-05-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Gregg H Novack in court, defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Felony Pretrial Order, filed.  Jury trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Gregg H Novack.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-11-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Darryl Eugene Deramus in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Both files were sent to in custody court Rm. 137, Both defendant are at MSDF they need to be produced for court.
Court date for 3-12-2014, Rm. 221, has been vacated.

Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-12-2014 at 1:00pm
